intro: Pilosella rothiana subsp. holopolia, commonly known as the Alpine mouse-ear, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of numerous small florets. The plant typically grows in alpine and subalpine habitats, preferring well-drained, rocky soils. It has hairy leaves and produces small yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months. This subspecies is notable for its adaptability to high-altitude environments and its role in supporting local pollinators.
